Package com.google.inject.tools.ideplugin

Tools integrating guice with development environments.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ActionsHandler The ActionsHandler responds to ActionsHandler.Action requests by taking the appropriate action, such as going to a given code location.
CustomContextDefinitionSource The source for finding custom module contexts defined by the user (CustomModuleContextRepresentation).
CustomContextDefinitionSource.CustomContextDefinitionListener A listener for changes in the custom contexts.
GotoCodeLocationHandler Perform ActionsHandler.GotoCodeLocation actions.
GotoFileHandler Perform ActionsHandler.GotoFile actions.
GuiceIDEPluginContextDefinition Users can implement this interface in their code to create a module context for the guice plugin.
JavaElement Representation of a Java element.
JavaProject Representation of a project (code set) in user code.
ProjectManager Manages the set of open projects in the user's code.
 

Class Summary
ActionsHandler.Action An Action is anything the IDE can do in response to a trigger.
ActionsHandler.GotoCodeLocation Represents the IDE action of going to a location in the code, i.e.
ActionsHandler.GotoFile An Action that opens a file to a declaration.
ActionsHandler.NullAction An action that does nothing.
CustomContextDefinitionSourceImpl  
GuicePlugin The main object of the plugin.
GuicePluginModule Abstract module for the plugin's dependency injection.
GuiceToolsModuleImpl The abstract implementation of the GuiceToolsModule specific to the IDE plugin.
ProjectSettings Represent the project wide settings for the plugin.
 

Enum Summary
JavaElement.Type The types of Java elements that can be represented.
 

Exception Summary
ActionsHandler.InvalidActionException Runtime exception thrown if run is called on an undefined action.
 

Package com.google.inject.tools.ideplugin Description

Tools integrating guice with development environments.

The GuicePlugin object is the equivalent of the main() routine for standard applcations; it creates the injector and starts the plugin. IDEs create plugin parts themselves and hand them to us as static objects (or instances accessible in static objects) so we must bind these instances in our GuicePluginModule subclasses (which are IDE specific).

The basic objects in our plugin are:

ModuleManager
manages the modules in the user's code
ProblemsHandler
notifies the user of guice related problems in the code
ResultsHandler
manages results of user queries such as finding bindings
BindingsEngine
performs the actual lookup of bindings in the code
CodeRunner
runs CodeSnippets in user space to resolve bindings
ProjectManager
manages projects in the IDE

Key objects which must be created in IDE specific manner are:

ModulesSource
listen for changes in the user's code involving modules
ModuleSelectionView
allow the user to configure what modules the plugin runs
ResultsView
displays results of searches, e.g. for bindings

IDE specific objects for creating the guice context menu, e.g. "Find Bindings" are also necessary.

The plugin is intended to be written simultaneously for all IDEs and use guice to inject the IDE specific implementations at runtime. See GuicePluginModule for more details.
